title: Mushroom Turnovers
description: Flaky pastry turnovers filled with a savory mushroom and herb mixture
ingredients: 2 sheets puff pastry thawed||1 lb mushrooms (cremini or button) finely chopped||2 tablespoons olive oil||3 cloves garlic minced||2 shallots finely chopped||2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves||1 tablespoon fresh rosemary chopped||1/4 cup vegetable broth||2 tablespoons all-purpose flour||1/4 cup cream cheese||1/2 teaspoon salt||1/4 teaspoon black pepper||1 egg beaten (for egg wash)||Sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)||Line a baking sheet with parchment paper||In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat||Add shallots and cook until softened about 2 minutes||Add mushrooms and garlic cook until mushrooms release their moisture and it evaporates about 7-8 minutes||Stir in thyme and rosemary||Sprinkle flour over mixture and stir to combine||Add vegetable broth and cook until thickened about 2 minutes||Remove from heat stir in cream cheese until melted||Season with salt and pepper||Let cool||Roll out puff pastry sheets and cut each into 9 equal squares||Place a spoonful of mushroom mixture in the center of each square||Fold pastry over filling to form triangles and seal edges with a fork||Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds||Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown and puffed||Allow to cool slightly before serving
recipe_notes: For best results, squeeze excess moisture from mushrooms before cooking

title: Crispy Samosas
description: Crispy pastry triangles filled with spiced potatoes and peas a popular Indian appetizer
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour||1/2 teaspoon salt||4 tablespoons vegetable oil||1/2 cup water||3 medium potatoes boiled and diced||1 cup green peas||2 tablespoons vegetable oil||1 teaspoon cumin seeds||1 onion finely chopped||2 cloves garlic minced||1 tablespoon ginger grated||1 green chili finely chopped (optional)||1 teaspoon ground cumin||1 teaspoon ground coriander||1/2 teaspoon turmeric||1/2 teaspoon garam masala||2 tablespoons fresh cilantro chopped||Salt to taste||Oil for deep frying||Mint chutney for serving
instructions: For the dough mix flour and salt in a bowl||Add oil and rub until mixture resembles breadcrumbs||Gradually add water and knead to form a firm dough||Cover and let rest for 30 minutes||For the filling heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds||When they splutter add onion garlic ginger and green chili||Cook until onions are golden brown then add ground spices and cook for 1 minute||Add potatoes and peas mix well||Season with salt and cook for 3-4 minutes||Stir in cilantro and remove from heat||Let the filling cool completely||Divide the dough into 10-12 equal portions||Roll each portion into a circle about 6 inches in diameter||Cut each circle in half||Wet the straight edge with water and form a cone||Fill the cone with about 2 tablespoons of the potato mixture||Seal the open edge by pressing firmly||Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) and deep fry samosas until golden brown about 3-4 minutes per batch||Drain on paper towels and serve hot with mint chutney
recipe_notes: Make sure oil is at proper temperature for best crispy results

title: Avocado Toast Bites
description: Bite-sized pieces of toasted baguette topped with creamy avocado cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of everything bagel seasoning
ingredients: 1 baguette sliced into 1/2-inch rounds||3 tablespoons olive oil||2 ripe avocados||1 tablespoon lemon juice||1/2 teaspoon salt||1/4 teaspoon black pepper||1 cup cherry tomatoes halved||2 tablespoons red onion finely diced||2 tablespoons everything bagel seasoning||Fresh microgreens for garnish (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)||Brush baguette slices with olive oil on both sides and place on a baking sheet||Bake for 5-7 minutes until lightly toasted||In a bowl mash avocados with lemon juice salt and pepper||Spread avocado mixture on toasted baguette slices||Top each with cherry tomato halves and diced red onion||Sprinkle with everything bagel seasoning||Garnish with microgreens if desired||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Use ripe but firm avocados for best texture

title: Sweet Potato Chickpea Bites
description: Roasted sweet potato rounds topped with a flavorful chickpea and herb salad
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes sliced into 1/2-inch rounds||2 tablespoons olive oil||1 teaspoon salt||1/2 teaspoon paprika||1 can (15 oz) chickpeas drained and rinsed||1/4 cup red bell pepper finely diced||1/4 cup cucumber finely diced||2 tablespoons red onion finely diced||2 tablespoons fresh parsley chopped||1 tablespoon fresh mint chopped||2 tablespoons lemon juice||1 tablespoon olive oil||1/2 teaspoon cumin||1/4 teaspoon salt||1/4 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C)||Line a baking sheet with parchment paper||Toss sweet potato rounds with olive oil salt and paprika||Arrange in a single layer on baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes flipping halfway through until tender and slightly crispy on edges||Meanwhile in a bowl combine chickpeas bell pepper cucumber red onion parsley and mint||In a small bowl whisk together lemon juice olive oil cumin salt and pepper||Pour dressing over chickpea mixture and toss to combine||Once sweet potatoes are done let cool slightly then top each round with a spoonful of chickpea salad||Arrange on a serving platter and serve warm or at room temperature
recipe_notes: Sweet potatoes can be roasted ahead of time and reheated

title: Crispy Zucchini Fritters
description: Golden crispy zucchini fritters served with a cool yogurt dipping sauce
ingredients: 2 medium zucchini grated||1 teaspoon salt plus more to taste||1/4 cup all-purpose flour||1/4 cup cornstarch||2 green onions finely chopped||2 tablespoons fresh dill chopped||1 clove garlic minced||1 egg beaten||1/4 teaspoon black pepper||Vegetable oil for frying||1 cup plain Greek yogurt||1 tablespoon lemon juice||1 tablespoon fresh mint chopped||1/2 teaspoon garlic powder||Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Place grated zucchini in a colander sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt and let sit for 10 minutes||Squeeze out as much moisture as possible from the zucchini using a clean kitchen towel||In a large bowl combine zucchini flour cornstarch green onions dill garlic egg and pepper||Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium heat||Drop heaping tablespoons of batter into the hot oil and flatten slightly||Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy||Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt while still hot||For the sauce mix Greek yogurt lemon juice mint garlic powder salt and pepper||Serve fritters hot with yogurt sauce on the side
recipe_notes: Removing moisture from zucchini is crucial for crispy fritters

title: Watermelon Feta Skewers
description: Refreshing skewers with sweet watermelon tangy feta cheese and fresh mint drizzled with balsamic glaze
ingredients: 1 small watermelon cut into 1-inch cubes||8 oz feta cheese cut into 1/2-inch cubes||1/4 cup fresh mint leaves||3 tablespoons balsamic glaze||2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil||Freshly ground black pepper||24 small skewers or toothpicks
instructions: Thread a watermelon cube followed by a mint leaf and then a feta cube onto each skewer||Arrange on a serving platter||Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil||Finish with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper||Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve (no more than 1 hour)
recipe_notes: Don't assemble too far in advance as watermelon will release juice

title: Smoky Baba Ganoush
description: Creamy smoky eggplant dip served with homemade crispy pita chips
ingredients: 2 large eggplants||3 tablespoons tahini||2 cloves garlic minced||2 tablespoons lemon juice||1 tablespoon olive oil plus more for drizzling||1/2 teaspoon ground cumin||1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika plus more for garnish||Salt and pepper to taste||2 tablespoons fresh parsley chopped||6 pita breads||2 tablespoons olive oil||1 teaspoon za'atar seasoning (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C)||Prick eggplants all over with a fork and place on a baking sheet||Roast for 30-40 minutes until skin is charred and flesh is soft||Let cool then cut in half and scoop out the flesh into a colander||Let drain for 10 minutes||Transfer eggplant to a food processor||Add tahini garlic lemon juice olive oil cumin smoked paprika salt and pepper||Pulse until smooth but still slightly textured||For pita chips reduce oven to 375°F (190°C)||Cut each pita into 8 triangles||Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with za'atar if using||Bake for 10-12 minutes until crispy and golden||Serve baba ganoush in a bowl drizzled with olive oil sprinkled with smoked paprika and parsley with pita chips on the side
recipe_notes: Charring the eggplant adds essential smoky flavor

title: Cucumber Cream Cheese Canapes
description: Fresh cucumber rounds topped with herb-infused cream cheese and garnished with radish and dill
ingredients: 2 English cucumbers||8 oz cream cheese softened||2 tablespoons fresh dill chopped||2 tablespoons fresh chives chopped||1 tablespoon lemon zest||1 clove garlic minced||Salt and pepper to taste||4 radishes thinly sliced||Fresh dill sprigs for garnish||Paprika for dusting
instructions: Slice cucumbers into 1/4-inch thick rounds||In a bowl combine cream cheese dill chives lemon zest garlic salt and pepper||Using a small spoon or piping bag add a dollop of the cream cheese mixture onto each cucumber round||Top each with a radish slice and a small sprig of dill||Dust lightly with paprika for color||Arrange on a serving platter and refrigerate until ready to serve
recipe_notes: Use English cucumbers for less seeds and better presentation

title: Crispy Vegetable Pakoras
description: Crispy Indian fritters made with assorted vegetables in a spiced chickpea batter
ingredients: 1 cup chickpea flour (besan)||1/2 teaspoon baking powder||1 teaspoon ground cumin||1 teaspoon ground coriander||1/2 teaspoon turmeric||1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper||1/2 teaspoon salt||3/4 cup water||1 small onion thinly sliced||1 potato thinly sliced||1 bell pepper thinly sliced||1 cup spinach leaves||1/4 cup fresh cilantro chopped||1 green chili finely chopped (optional)||Vegetable oil for deep frying||Mint chutney for serving
instructions: In a large bowl combine chickpea flour baking powder cumin coriander turmeric cayenne pepper and salt||Gradually add water whisking to form a smooth batter (consistency of thick pancake batter)||Add vegetables cilantro and green chili if using||Mix well to coat all vegetables||Heat oil in a deep pan or wok to 350°F (175°C)||Drop spoonfuls of the vegetable mixture into the hot oil||Fry in batches for 3-4 minutes until golden brown and crispy||Drain on paper towels and serve hot with mint chutney
recipe_notes: Maintain proper oil temperature for crispiest results

title: Almond Stuffed Dates
description: Sweet Medjool dates stuffed with crunchy almonds and brightened with orange zest
ingredients: 24 Medjool dates||24 whole almonds roasted and unsalted||1 orange zested||1/4 teaspoon cinnamon||2 tablespoons honey||2 tablespoons pistachios finely chopped (for garnish)
instructions: Make a lengthwise slit in each date and remove the pit||Insert an almond into each date||Arrange dates on a serving plate||In a small bowl mix orange zest and cinnamon||Drizzle honey over the dates||Sprinkle with the orange zest mixture and garnish with chopped pistachios||Serve at room temperature
recipe_notes: Choose soft, plump Medjool dates for best results

title: Oatmeal Breakfast Bowl
description: Hearty oatmeal topped with nuts and fruit for a nutritious start
ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats||2 cups milk||1/4 teaspoon salt||1 tablespoon honey||1/2 cup sliced almonds||1/2 cup blueberries
instructions: Bring milk to a boil with salt||Add oats and simmer for 5 minutes stirring occasionally||Remove from heat stir in honey||Top with almonds and blueberries||Serve warm
recipe_notes: Use steel-cut oats for chewier texture if preferred

title: Scrambled Egg Muffins
description: Portable muffins with eggs, cheese, and veggies
ingredients: 6 large eggs||1/4 cup milk||1/2 cup shredded cheddar||1/4 cup diced bell peppers||1/4 cup chopped spinach||Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)||Whisk eggs and milk season with salt and pepper||Mix in cheddar bell peppers and spinach||Pour into greased muffin tin||Bake for 20 minutes||Cool slightly before serving
recipe_notes: Store in refrigerator for up to 5 days for meal prep

title: Banana Nut Waffles
description: Fluffy waffles with banana and walnut flavor
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups flour||1 tablespoon sugar||1 tablespoon baking powder||1/2 teaspoon salt||1 cup milk||1 egg||2 tablespoons melted butter||1 mashed banana||1/4 cup chopped walnuts
instructions: Preheat waffle iron||Mix dry ingredients then add milk egg butter and banana||Stir in walnuts||Cook batter in waffle iron per manufacturer's instructions||Serve warm
recipe_notes: Mash banana well to avoid lumps in batter

title: Vegan Chia Pudding
description: Creamy chia seed pudding with a tropical twist
ingredients: 1/4 cup chia seeds||1 cup coconut milk||1 tablespoon maple syrup||1/2 teaspoon vanilla||1/2 cup mango chunks
instructions: Mix chia seeds coconut milk maple syrup and vanilla||Let sit for 10 minutes stir then refrigerate for 2 hours||Top with mango chunks before serving
recipe_notes: Can be made the night before for easy morning meal

title: Sausage Breakfast Skillet
description: Hearty skillet with sausage, potatoes, and eggs
ingredients: 1/2 lb sausage||2 cups diced potatoes||1 tablespoon olive oil||4 eggs||Salt and pepper to taste||1/4 cup shredded cheese
instructions: Heat oil cook sausage and potatoes until browned about 15 minutes||Push to side crack eggs into skillet cook until set 5-10 minutes||Season top with cheese||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Use cast iron skillet for best heat distribution

title: Yogurt Berry Parfait
description: Layered yogurt and berries for a light breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt||2 tablespoons honey||1 cup mixed berries||1/2 cup granola
instructions: Layer yogurt honey berries and granola in glasses||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Use variety of berries for best color and flavor

title: French Toast Sticks
description: Crispy sticks of French toast, perfect for dipping
ingredients: 4 slices bread||2 eggs||1/2 cup milk||1 teaspoon cinnamon||2 tablespoons butter||Maple syrup for dipping
instructions: Whisk eggs milk and cinnamon||Dip bread slices cut into sticks||Cook in butter over medium heat 2-3 minutes per side||Serve with maple syrup
recipe_notes: Cut bread into uniform sticks for even cooking

title: Breakfast Burrito Bowl
description: Rice and bean bowl with scrambled eggs and salsa
ingredients: 1 cup cooked rice||2 eggs||1/4 cup black beans||1/4 cup salsa||1 tablespoon olive oil||1/4 cup avocado slices
instructions: Heat oil scramble eggs||Layer rice beans eggs and salsa in bowls||Top with avocado||Serve warm
recipe_notes: Add hot sauce or cheese for extra flavor

title: Cinnamon Apple Toast
description: Toasted bread with cinnamon apples
ingredients: 2 slices bread||1 apple sliced||1 tablespoon butter||1 teaspoon cinnamon||1 tablespoon sugar
instructions: Toast bread||Cook apple slices with butter cinnamon and sugar until soft 5 minutes||Spoon over toast||Serve warm
recipe_notes: Use Honeycrisp or Granny Smith apples for best flavor

title: Vegan Breakfast Scramble
description: Tofu scramble with veggies for a plant-based meal
ingredients: 14 oz tofu||1 tablespoon olive oil||1/2 cup diced tomatoes||1/4 cup spinach||1/2 teaspoon turmeric||Salt to taste
instructions: Heat oil crumble tofu into skillet||Add tomatoes spinach turmeric and salt||Cook for 10 minutes||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Press tofu beforehand to remove excess moisture

title: Peanut Butter Banana Toast
description: Simple toast with peanut butter and banana
ingredients: 2 slices bread||2 tablespoons peanut butter||1 banana sliced
instructions: Toast bread||Spread peanut butter||Top with banana slices||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Drizzle with honey for extra sweetness

title: Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash
description: Savory hash with sweet potatoes and onions
ingredients: 2 sweet potatoes diced||1 onion chopped||1 tablespoon olive oil||Salt and pepper to taste||4 eggs (optional)
instructions: Heat oil cook sweet potatoes and onion until tender 20-25 minutes||Season||Top with fried eggs if desired||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Cut sweet potatoes uniformly for even cooking

title: Chicken Biryani
description: Aromatic basmati rice with tender chicken pieces
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice||1 kg chicken cut in pieces||1 cup yogurt||2 onions sliced||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||1 tsp red chili powder||1/2 tsp turmeric||1 tsp garam masala||4 green cardamom||2 bay leaves||1 cinnamon stick||Salt to taste||Oil for frying||Fresh mint leaves||Saffron soaked in milk
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 30 minutes||Soak rice for 30 minutes||Fry onions until golden, set aside||Cook marinated chicken until tender||Boil rice with whole spices until 70% done||Layer rice and chicken alternately||Top with fried onions, mint, saffron milk||Cover and cook on dum for 45 minutes||Serve hot with raita
recipe_notes: Use aged basmati rice for best results. Let it rest after cooking for better flavor

title: Beef Kala Bhuna
description: Traditional Chittagong style dry beef curry
ingredients: 1 kg beef cut in cubes||2 onions chopped||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp cumin powder||4 green chilies||1 cup oil||Salt to taste||Fresh coriander leaves
instructions: Heat oil and fry beef pieces until browned||Add onions, cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste, cook for 2 minutes||Add all spices, cook until fragrant||Add very little water, cover and cook slowly||Stir occasionally until beef is tender and dry||Garnish with green chilies and coriander||Serve with rice or roti
recipe_notes: Cook on low heat for authentic Chittagong flavor. The dish should be almost dry

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Creamy Italian pasta with eggs and pancetta
ingredients: 400g spaghetti||200g pancetta diced||4 large eggs||1 cup grated Parmesan||2 cloves garlic||Black pepper to taste||Salt for pasta water||2 tbsp olive oil
instructions: Boil salted water and cook spaghetti al dente||Beat eggs with Parmesan and black pepper||Heat oil, cook pancetta until crispy||Add minced garlic, cook 1 minute||Drain pasta, reserve 1 cup pasta water||Add hot pasta to pancetta||Remove from heat, quickly mix in egg mixture||Add pasta water gradually until creamy||Serve immediately with extra Parmesan
recipe_notes: Never let eggs scramble. Work quickly off the heat for creamy texture

title: Fish Curry Bengali Style
description: Traditional Bengali fish curry with potatoes
ingredients: 1 kg rohu fish cut in steaks||2 potatoes cubed||1 onion chopped||1 tsp ginger paste||1 tsp garlic paste||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||2 bay leaves||4 green chilies||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Fresh coriander
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoking, let it cool slightly||Fry fish pieces until golden, set aside||Fry potato cubes until golden||In same oil, add bay leaves and onions||Add ginger-garlic paste, cook until fragrant||Add all spices, cook for 2 minutes||Add water to make gravy||Add potatoes and fish||Simmer until gravy thickens||Garnish with coriander and green chilies
recipe_notes: Use fresh rohu or katla fish for authentic taste. Don't overcook the fish

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Grilled chicken in rich tomato cream sauce
ingredients: 1 kg chicken breast cubed||1 cup yogurt||2 tsp garam masala||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 onions chopped||4 tomatoes chopped||1 cup heavy cream||2 tbsp tomato paste||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 tbsp oil||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 2 hours||Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked||Blend onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic||Heat oil, cook the paste until thick||Add tomato paste, cook 2 minutes||Add cream and grilled chicken||Simmer for 10 minutes||Adjust seasoning||Garnish with cilantro
recipe_notes: Marinating longer gives better flavor. Use full-fat cream for richness

title: Bhuna Khichuri
description: Spiced rice and lentil dish with vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||1/2 cup masoor dal||1/2 cup mixed vegetables||2 onions sliced||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 bay leaves||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||4 cups water||Ghee||Salt to taste||Boiled eggs for serving
instructions: Wash rice and dal together||Heat ghee, fry onions until golden||Add cumin seeds, bay leaves||Add ginger-garlic paste||Add vegetables, cook 5 minutes||Add rice and dal, mix well||Add spices and water||Cook covered until rice is done||Stir gently, adjust consistency||Serve hot with boiled eggs and pickles
recipe_notes: Perfect comfort food for rainy days. Adjust water for desired consistency

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef in creamy mushroom sauce
ingredients: 600g beef sirloin sliced||300g mushrooms sliced||1 onion chopped||2 tbsp flour||1 cup beef broth||1 cup sour cream||2 tbsp butter||2 tbsp oil||1 tsp paprika||Salt and pepper||Fresh parsley||Egg noodles for serving
instructions: Heat oil in large pan, sear beef strips||Remove beef, set aside||Melt butter, sauté onions until soft||Add mushrooms, cook until browned||Sprinkle flour, cook 1 minute||Gradually add broth, stirring constantly||Return beef to pan||Simmer 5 minutes until tender||Stir in sour cream and paprika||Season with salt and pepper||Serve over egg noodles
recipe_notes: Don't boil after adding sour cream to prevent curdling

title: Shorshe Ilish
description: Hilsa fish in mustard sauce - Bengali delicacy
ingredients: 1 kg hilsa fish cut in steaks||3 tbsp mustard seeds||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Nigella seeds||Green chilies for garnish
instructions: Grind mustard seeds with green chilies and little water||Marinate fish with turmeric and salt||Heat mustard oil until smoking||Fry fish lightly on both sides||In same oil, add nigella seeds||Add mustard paste, cook until fragrant||Add little water to make thin gravy||Add fried fish pieces||Cover and simmer 5 minutes||Garnish with slit green chilies
recipe_notes: Use fresh hilsa for authentic taste. Don't overcook to maintain fish texture

title: Chicken Caesar Wrap
description: Grilled chicken with Caesar salad in tortilla
ingredients: 4 large tortillas||2 chicken breasts||1 head romaine lettuce||1/2 cup Caesar dressing||1/4 cup Parmesan cheese||1/4 cup croutons crushed||2 tbsp olive oil||Salt and pepper||Lemon juice
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper||Grill chicken until cooked through||Let cool and slice into strips||Wash and chop romaine lettuce||Mix lettuce with Caesar dressing||Warm tortillas slightly||Place lettuce mixture on tortilla||Add sliced chicken||Sprinkle Parmesan and crushed croutons||Roll tightly and cut in half||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Crush croutons for better texture in wrap. Warm tortillas for easy rolling

title: Morog Pulao
description: Aromatic chicken pilaf Bengali style
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice||1 kg chicken cut in pieces||1 cup yogurt||2 onions sliced||4 green cardamom||2 bay leaves||1 cinnamon stick||4 cloves||1 tsp ginger paste||1 tsp garlic paste||1 tsp red chili powder||1/2 tsp turmeric||Ghee||Salt to taste||Saffron
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices||Soak rice for 30 minutes||Heat ghee, fry onions until golden||Add whole spices, then chicken||Cook chicken until 80% done||In another pot, boil rice with whole spices||Layer rice over chicken||Sprinkle fried onions and saffron||Cover tightly, cook on dum for 30 minutes||Let it rest 10 minutes before serving
recipe_notes: Use good quality basmati rice. Dum cooking is essential for authentic flavor

title: Thai Green Curry
description: Spicy coconut curry with vegetables
ingredients: 400ml coconut milk||3 tbsp green curry paste||500g mixed vegetables||2 chicken breasts sliced||2 thai eggplants||1 red bell pepper||Thai basil leaves||2 tbsp fish sauce||1 tbsp palm sugar||2 kaffir lime leaves||2 thai chilies||Jasmine rice for serving
instructions: Heat thick coconut milk in wok||Add curry paste, fry until fragrant||Add chicken, cook until white||Add remaining coconut milk||Add hard vegetables first||Simmer until vegetables are tender||Add fish sauce and palm sugar||Add lime leaves and basil||Adjust seasoning||Serve hot with jasmine rice
recipe_notes: Use Thai ingredients for authentic flavor. Don't overcook vegetables

title: Dal Bhat Tarkari
description: Complete Bengali meal with dal, rice and vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup rice||1 cup masoor dal||2 cups mixed vegetables||2 onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 bay leaves||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Fresh coriander
instructions: Cook rice separately||Boil dal with turmeric until soft||Heat oil, add cumin seeds and bay leaves||Add onions, cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add vegetables, cook until tender||Add cooked dal and mix||Simmer until thick consistency||Garnish with coriander||Serve with rice and pickle
recipe_notes: This is everyday Bengali comfort food. Adjust vegetables as per season

title: Beef Tacos
description: Mexican-style seasoned ground beef tacos
ingredients: 500g ground beef||8 taco shells||1 onion diced||2 cloves garlic minced||1 tbsp chili powder||1 tsp cumin||1 tsp paprika||1/2 tsp oregano||Salt and pepper||Lettuce shredded||Tomatoes diced||Cheese shredded||Sour cream||Salsa
instructions: Heat oil in large pan||Cook onion until soft||Add garlic, cook 1 minute||Add ground beef, cook until browned||Add spices, cook 2 minutes||Add little water, simmer 5 minutes||Warm taco shells as per package||Fill shells with beef mixture||Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese||Serve with sour cream and salsa
recipe_notes: Don't overfill tacos. Serve immediately while shells are warm

title: Chingri Malai Curry
description: Prawns in coconut cream curry
ingredients: 500g large prawns||1 cup coconut milk||2 onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||2 bay leaves||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Fresh coriander||Garam masala powder
instructions: Clean and devein prawns||Heat mustard oil, fry prawns lightly||Remove prawns, set aside||In same oil, add bay leaves||Add onions, cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add all spices, cook until fragrant||Add coconut milk and bring to boil||Add fried prawns||Simmer 5 minutes until prawns are cooked||Sprinkle garam masala and coriander
recipe_notes: Don't overcook prawns as they become rubbery. Use fresh coconut milk

title: Chicken Quesadilla
description: Grilled tortilla filled with seasoned chicken and cheese
ingredients: 4 large tortillas||2 chicken breasts cooked and shredded||2 cups cheese shredded||1 bell pepper diced||1 onion diced||2 tbsp oil||1 tsp chili powder||1/2 tsp cumin||Salt and pepper||Sour cream||Guacamole||Salsa
instructions: Season shredded chicken with spices||Heat oil, sauté onion and bell pepper||Add seasoned chicken, cook 3 minutes||Place filling on half of each tortilla||Top with cheese||Fold tortilla over||Cook in dry pan until golden and crispy||Flip and cook other side||Cut into wedges||Serve with sour cream, guacamole, salsa
recipe_notes: Press down while cooking for crispy exterior. Don't overfill

title: Kochu Shak Ghonto
description: Traditional Bengali taro leaves curry
ingredients: 500g taro leaves cleaned||1 cup mixed vegetables||2 onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 bay leaves||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Panch phoron||Dried red chilies
instructions: Clean taro leaves thoroughly||Chop leaves finely||Heat mustard oil||Add panch phoron and dried chilies||Add bay leaves and onions||Cook until onions are golden||Add garlic and green chilies||Add chopped taro leaves||Add vegetables and turmeric||Cover and cook until leaves are tender||Stir occasionally||Adjust seasoning||Serve with rice
recipe_notes: Wear gloves while handling raw taro leaves. Cook thoroughly to avoid itching

title: Beef and Broccoli
description: Chinese-American stir fry with tender beef
ingredients: 500g beef sirloin sliced||4 cups broccoli florets||3 tbsp soy sauce||2 tbsp oyster sauce||1 tbsp cornstarch||2 cloves garlic minced||1 tsp ginger minced||2 tbsp oil||1 tsp sesame oil||1/4 cup beef broth||Rice for serving||Salt and pepper
instructions: Marinate beef with soy sauce and cornstarch||Blanch broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes||Heat oil in wok over high heat||Stir-fry beef until browned||Remove beef, set aside||Add garlic and ginger to wok||Add broccoli, stir-fry 2 minutes||Return beef to wok||Add oyster sauce and broth||Stir-fry until sauce thickens||Drizzle sesame oil||Serve over rice
recipe_notes: High heat is essential for proper stir-frying. Don't overcook broccoli

title: Mutton Rezala
description: Mughlai style mutton in white curry
ingredients: 1 kg mutton cut in pieces||1 cup yogurt||1 cup onions fried||1/2 cup cashews||1/4 cup almonds||4 green cardamom||2 bay leaves||1 cinnamon stick||1 tsp ginger paste||1 tsp garlic paste||1/2 cup milk||Ghee||Salt to taste||White pepper||Kewra water
instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt for 2 hours||Soak nuts in warm milk||Heat ghee, add whole spices||Add marinated mutton, cook until tender||Grind fried onions with soaked nuts||Add this paste to mutton||Add milk gradually||Simmer until gravy is thick||Season with white pepper and salt||Sprinkle kewra water||Garnish with nuts
recipe_notes: This is a white curry, avoid using any red spices. Cook on low heat

title: Greek Salad with Chicken
description: Mediterranean salad with grilled chicken
ingredients: 2 chicken breasts||4 cups mixed greens||1 cucumber diced||2 tomatoes chopped||1/2 red onion sliced||1/2 cup feta cheese||1/4 cup olives||3 tbsp olive oil||2 tbsp lemon juice||1 tsp oregano||Salt and pepper||Pita bread
instructions: Season chicken with oregano, salt, pepper||Grill chicken until cooked through||Let cool and slice||Mix olive oil, lemon juice, oregano for dressing||Combine greens, cucumber, tomatoes, onion||Add sliced chicken||Top with feta and olives||Drizzle with dressing||Toss gently||Serve with warm pita bread
recipe_notes: Use good quality feta and extra virgin olive oil for best flavor

title: Begun Bharta
description: Mashed roasted eggplant curry Bengali style
ingredients: 2 large eggplants||2 onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Fresh coriander||Boiled rice for serving
instructions: Roast eggplants over open flame until charred||Cool and peel off skin||Mash the flesh coarsely||Heat mustard oil||Add onions, cook until golden||Add garlic and green chilies||Add turmeric and chili powder||Add mashed eggplant||Mix well and cook 10 minutes||Adjust seasoning||Garnish with coriander||Serve with rice
recipe_notes: Roasting over flame gives authentic smoky flavor. Don't make it too smooth

title: Pad Thai
description: Classic Thai stir-fried rice noodles
ingredients: 200g rice noodles||200g shrimp||2 eggs||1 cup bean sprouts||3 tbsp tamarind paste||2 tbsp fish sauce||2 tbsp palm sugar||3 cloves garlic||2 shallots||Peanuts crushed||Lime wedges||Chili flakes||Oil for cooking
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft||Heat oil in wok||Add garlic and shallots||Add shrimp, cook until pink||Push to one side, scramble eggs||Add noodles and sauce mixture||Toss everything together||Add bean sprouts||Stir-fry 2 minutes||Garnish with peanuts and lime||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Balance of sweet, sour, and salty is key. Don't oversoak noodles

title: Chicken Kofta Curry
description: Spiced chicken meatballs in rich curry sauce
ingredients: 500g ground chicken||1 onion finely chopped||2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp garam masala||2 tbsp breadcrumbs||1 egg||Oil for frying||For curry: 2 onions||3 tomatoes||1 cup yogurt||Spices||Fresh coriander
instructions: Mix ground chicken with chopped onion, spices, breadcrumbs, egg||Form into small balls||Deep fry koftas until golden||For curry, blend onions and tomatoes||Cook paste until thick||Add yogurt and spices||Add water to make gravy||Add fried koftas||Simmer 15 minutes||Garnish with coriander||Serve with rice or naan
recipe_notes: Don't make koftas too large. Fry on medium heat for even cooking

title: Aloo Posto
description: Bengali potato curry with poppy seeds
ingredients: 4 large potatoes cubed||3 tbsp poppy seeds||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||Mustard oil||Salt to taste||Nigella seeds||Dried red chilies||Water as needed
instructions: Soak poppy seeds for 30 minutes||Grind with green chilies to paste||Heat mustard oil||Add nigella seeds and dried chilies||Add potato cubes||Fry until lightly golden||Add turmeric and salt||Add poppy seed paste||Mix well and cook covered||Add little water if needed||Cook until potatoes are tender||Adjust seasoning
recipe_notes: Grinding poppy seeds well is important for smooth texture

title: Beef Kala Bhuna
description: Traditional Chittagong style slow-cooked beef curry
ingredients: 1 kg beef cut into chunks||2 large onions sliced||6 cloves garlic minced||2 inch ginger paste||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp cumin powder||4 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||4 green cardamom||2 cinnamon sticks||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro for garnish
instructions: Heat mustard oil in heavy bottom pot||Add whole spices and fry for 30 seconds||Add sliced onions and cook until deep brown||Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes||Add beef pieces and brown on all sides||Add all dry spices and mix well||Cover and cook on low heat for 2-3 hours stirring occasionally||Add water if needed||Cook until beef is tender and oil separates||Garnish with cilantro and serve hot
recipe_notes: Patience is key - slow cooking gives the best flavor. Don't add too much water at once

title: Hilsa Fish Curry
description: National fish of Bangladesh in traditional curry
ingredients: 6 pieces hilsa fish||2 medium onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies slit||1 tsp turmeric powder||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp coriander powder||3 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 cup water||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro leaves
instructions: Clean and marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes||Heat mustard oil in pan and lightly fry fish pieces||Remove fish and set aside||In same oil add cumin seeds and bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add all spices and cook for 2 minutes||Add water and bring to boil||Gently add fried fish pieces||Simmer for 15-20 minutes||Garnish with cilantro and serve
recipe_notes: Handle hilsa carefully as it has many small bones. Fry fish lightly to prevent breaking

title: Chicken Biryani
description: Aromatic layered rice dish with spiced chicken
ingredients: 1 kg basmati rice||1 kg chicken cut into pieces||2 cups yogurt||2 large onions sliced||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp biryani masala||4 tbsp ghee||3 tbsp oil||4 bay leaves||6 green cardamom||4 black cardamom||2 cinnamon sticks||1 tsp cumin seeds||Saffron soaked in warm milk||Fresh mint leaves||Fried onions||Salt to taste
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, half the spices, ginger-garlic paste for 2 hours||Cook rice with whole spices until 70% done||In heavy bottom pot, heat ghee and oil||Fry sliced onions until golden brown||Add marinated chicken and cook until 80% done||In another layer add partially cooked rice||Sprinkle fried onions, mint, saffron milk||Cover with aluminum foil then lid||Cook on high heat for 3 minutes, then low heat for 45 minutes||Let it rest for 10 minutes before opening||Gently mix and serve hot
recipe_notes: Use good quality basmati rice and don't overcook. The dum cooking process is crucial

title: Mutton Rezala
description: Mughlai style creamy mutton curry
ingredients: 1 kg mutton cut into pieces||1 cup yogurt||2 large onions||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||4 green chilies||1 tsp white pepper powder||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp garam masala||4 tbsp ghee||2 bay leaves||4 green cardamom||2 cinnamon sticks||1/2 cup cashews||1/4 cup poppy seeds||1 cup milk||Salt to taste
instructions: Soak cashews and poppy seeds in warm milk for 30 minutes||Marinate mutton with yogurt, half the spices for 1 hour||Make paste of soaked cashews, poppy seeds with milk||Heat ghee in heavy bottom pan||Add whole spices and fry||Add sliced onions and cook until light golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add marinated mutton and cook on medium heat||Add cashew-poppy paste and remaining spices||Cover and cook for 1.5-2 hours until tender||Adjust consistency with water if needed||Serve hot with rice or roti
recipe_notes: The white color is characteristic of Rezala. Don't let onions get too brown

title: Panta Bhat with Shutki
description: Traditional fermented rice with dried fish curry
ingredients: 3 cups cooked rice||Water for soaking||200g shutki (dried fish)||2 medium onions chopped||4 green chilies||6 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||3 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||Salt to taste||Chopped cilantro||Sliced onions and chilies for serving
instructions: Soak cooked rice in water overnight||Clean and wash shutki thoroughly||Heat mustard oil in pan||Add bay leaves and chopped onions||Cook onions until golden brown||Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes||Add cleaned shutki and fry for 5 minutes||Add green chilies, turmeric, and chili powder||Cook for 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally||Add little water if needed||Cook until shutki is well cooked||Serve panta bhat with shutki curry||Garnish with fresh onions, chilies, and cilantro
recipe_notes: Shutki should be cleaned properly to remove excess salt. Panta bhat is best when slightly sour

title: Dal Gosht
description: Hearty lentil curry with tender mutton pieces
ingredients: 1 cup masur dal (red lentils)||500g mutton cut small||2 medium onions||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp coriander powder||3 tbsp oil||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||3 cups water||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro for garnish
instructions: Wash and soak lentils for 30 minutes||Heat oil in pressure cooker||Add cumin seeds and bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add mutton pieces and brown them||Add all dry spices and cook for 2 minutes||Add soaked lentils and water||Pressure cook for 6-7 whistles||Let pressure release naturally||Simmer for 10 minutes if needed||Adjust consistency with water||Garnish with cilantro and serve hot
recipe_notes: Don't overcook lentils as they will become mushy. Adjust spices according to taste

title: Rui Fish Kalia
description: Bengali style fish curry with rich gravy
ingredients: 1 kg rui fish cut into steaks||2 large onions||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||3 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp garam masala||4 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||2 tomatoes chopped||1 cup water||Salt to taste||Cilantro for garnish
instructions: Clean fish and marinate with turmeric and salt||Heat mustard oil and fry fish pieces lightly||Remove and set aside||Make paste of onions, ginger, garlic||In same oil add bay leaves||Add onion paste and cook until oil separates||Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft||Add all dry spices and cook for 3-4 minutes||Add water and bring to boil||Gently add fried fish pieces||Add green chilies and simmer for 15 minutes||Garnish with cilantro and serve
recipe_notes: Fry fish on medium heat to prevent breaking. The gravy should be thick and rich

title: Khichuri with Chicken
description: Comfort food rice and lentil porridge with spiced chicken
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||1/2 cup masur dal||1/2 cup moong dal||500g chicken cut into pieces||2 medium onions||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp garam masala||4 tbsp ghee||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||4 cups water||Salt to taste||Fried onions for garnish
instructions: Wash and soak rice and lentils together for 30 minutes||Heat ghee in heavy bottom pot||Add cumin seeds and bay leaves||Add sliced onions and fry until golden||Add chicken pieces and cook until white||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add all spices and cook for 5 minutes||Add soaked rice and lentils||Add water and salt||Bring to boil then simmer covered for 45 minutes||Stir occasionally and add water if needed||Cook until creamy consistency||Garnish with fried onions and serve hot
recipe_notes: Stir gently to prevent sticking. Consistency should be like thick porridge

title: Beef Bhuna Khichuri
description: Special occasion rice dish with slow-cooked beef
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||1/2 cup masur dal||750g beef cut into pieces||3 large onions||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||4 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp garam masala||5 tbsp ghee||3 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 cinnamon stick||4 green cardamom||5 cups water||Salt to taste||Mint leaves for garnish
instructions: First prepare beef bhuna: heat 3 tbsp ghee in heavy pot||Add whole spices and fry||Add 2 sliced onions and cook until dark brown||Add beef and brown on all sides||Add half the ginger-garlic paste and spices||Cook covered on low heat for 1.5 hours until tender||In another pot, wash rice and lentils||Heat remaining ghee, add cumin seeds||Add remaining onion, ginger-garlic paste||Add rice, lentils, and remaining spices||Add water and prepared beef bhuna||Cook covered for 45 minutes stirring occasionally||Garnish with mint and serve
recipe_notes: The beef should be very tender before adding to rice. Cook on low heat to prevent burning

title: Chingri Malai Curry
description: Prawns in rich coconut milk curry
ingredients: 500g large prawns cleaned||1 cup thick coconut milk||2 medium onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||3 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1/2 tsp garam masala||3 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||1 tsp sugar||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro for garnish
instructions: Clean prawns and marinate with turmeric and salt||Heat mustard oil in pan||Lightly fry prawns and remove||In same oil add bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until light golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Cook for 2 minutes||Add turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder||Cook spices for 1 minute||Add coconut milk and bring to gentle boil||Add sugar and salt||Add fried prawns and simmer for 8-10 minutes||Don't overcook prawns||Garnish with cilantro and serve hot
recipe_notes: Don't boil coconut milk vigorously as it may curdle. Prawns cook quickly

title: Aloo Posto
description: Traditional Bengali potato curry with poppy seeds
ingredients: 4 large potatoes cubed||3 tbsp poppy seeds||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||3 tbsp mustard oil||1 tsp nigella seeds||2 bay leaves||1 tsp sugar||Salt to taste||Water as needed
instructions: Soak poppy seeds in warm water for 30 minutes||Grind soaked poppy seeds with green chilies to smooth paste||Heat mustard oil in pan||Add nigella seeds and bay leaves||Add cubed potatoes and fry until light golden||Add turmeric and mix well||Add poppy seed paste and mix||Add chili powder, sugar, and salt||Add little water and cover||Cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes||Stir occasionally and add water if needed||Cook until potatoes are tender||Serve hot with rice
recipe_notes: Poppy seed paste should be very smooth. Don't add too much water at once

title: Kochu Shaak Bhaji
description: Traditional taro leaves curry with small fish
ingredients: 500g kochu shaak (taro leaves)||200g small fish (mola/dhela)||2 medium onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||3 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||3 tbsp mustard oil||1 tsp nigella seeds||2 bay leaves||Salt to taste||Water as needed
instructions: Clean kochu shaak thoroughly and chop||Clean small fish and wash well||Heat mustard oil in pan||Add nigella seeds and bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add cleaned small fish and fry for 5 minutes||Add turmeric and chili powder||Add chopped kochu shaak||Mix well and add salt||Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes||Stir occasionally||Cook until shaak is tender||Serve hot with rice
recipe_notes: Kochu shaak can cause itching, so handle carefully. Cook well to reduce any irritation

title: Mutton Kacchi Biryani
description: Traditional raw meat biryani cooked in sealed pot
ingredients: 1 kg basmati rice||1 kg mutton cut into pieces||1 cup yogurt||3 large onions sliced||8 cloves garlic||3 inch ginger||4 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||3 tsp biryani masala||6 tbsp ghee||4 tbsp oil||6 bay leaves||8 green cardamom||6 black cardamom||4 cinnamon sticks||2 tsp cumin seeds||Saffron in warm milk||Fresh mint and cilantro||Fried onions||Boiled eggs||Salt to taste
instructions: Marinate raw mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, all spices for 4 hours||Deep fry sliced onions until golden brown||Soak rice for 30 minutes||Boil rice with whole spices until 70% done||In heavy bottom pot, spread marinated mutton||Layer with partially cooked rice||Sprinkle fried onions, mint, cilantro, saffron milk||Add boiled eggs||Dot with ghee||Cover with aluminum foil then tight lid||Cook on high heat for 5 minutes||Then on low heat for 2 hours||Let rest for 30 minutes before opening||Gently mix and serve
recipe_notes: The key is cooking raw meat and rice together. Seal the pot properly for best results

title: Fish Head Curry
description: Traditional curry made with large fish head
ingredients: 1 large rohu/katla fish head||2 medium onions||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||3 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp coriander powder||4 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 tomatoes chopped||1 cup water||Salt to taste||Cilantro for garnish
instructions: Clean fish head thoroughly and cut into 2-3 pieces||Marinate with turmeric and salt for 20 minutes||Heat mustard oil in large pan||Fry fish head pieces lightly and remove||Add cumin seeds and bay leaves to same oil||Add sliced onions and cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft||Add all dry spices and cook for 3 minutes||Add water and bring to boil||Add fried fish head pieces||Cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes||Garnish with cilantro and serve
recipe_notes: Fish head has lots of flavor but handle carefully. The curry should have thick gravy

title: Chicken Roast
description: Spicy dry chicken curry perfect for dinner
ingredients: 1 whole chicken cut into pieces||2 large onions sliced||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||4 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp garam masala||5 tbsp oil||3 bay leaves||1 cinnamon stick||4 green cardamom||1 cup yogurt||2 tomatoes chopped||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro||Fried onions for garnish
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, half the ginger-garlic paste, and half the spices for 1 hour||Heat oil in heavy bottom pan||Add whole spices and fry||Add sliced onions and cook until deep golden||Add remaining ginger-garlic paste||Add marinated chicken and cook on medium heat||Add chopped tomatoes and remaining spices||Cook covered for 30-40 minutes stirring occasionally||Cook until chicken is tender and oil separates||The curry should be dry with no gravy||Garnish with fried onions and cilantro||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Cook on medium heat and stir regularly to prevent burning. The dish should be dry

title: Begun Bhaja with Dal
description: Fried eggplant with spiced lentil curry
ingredients: 2 large eggplants sliced||1 cup masur dal||2 medium onions||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp cumin powder||4 tbsp mustard oil||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||3 cups water||Salt to taste||Cilantro for garnish
instructions: Slice eggplants and sprinkle with turmeric and salt||Let sit for 15 minutes||Wash and soak lentils for 30 minutes||Heat 3 tbsp oil and fry eggplant slices until golden||Remove and set aside||In same oil add cumin seeds and bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add soaked lentils and water||Add turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder||Boil then simmer for 20-25 minutes||Add fried eggplant in last 5 minutes||Garnish with cilantro and serve||Serve with rice
recipe_notes: Fry eggplant on medium heat to cook evenly. Don't add eggplant too early to dal

title: Pui Shaak with Chingri
description: Malabar spinach curry with small prawns
ingredients: 500g pui shaak (Malabar spinach)||200g small prawns||2 medium onions chopped||4 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||3 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||3 tbsp mustard oil||1 tsp nigella seeds||2 bay leaves||1 tsp sugar||Salt to taste
instructions: Clean pui shaak and chop roughly||Clean small prawns thoroughly||Heat mustard oil in pan||Add nigella seeds and bay leaves||Add chopped onions and cook until light golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies||Add cleaned prawns and cook for 3-4 minutes||Add turmeric and chili powder||Add chopped pui shaak||Mix well and add salt and sugar||Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes||Stir occasionally||Cook until shaak is tender||Serve hot with rice
recipe_notes: Pui shaak cooks quickly and becomes slimy if overcooked. Add sugar to balance taste

title: Mutton Curry
description: Traditional Bengali mutton curry with rich gravy
ingredients: 1 kg mutton cut into pieces||3 large onions||6 cloves garlic||2 inch ginger||4 green chilies||2 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tsp coriander powder||1 tsp cumin powder||1 tsp garam masala||5 tbsp mustard oil||3 bay leaves||1 cinnamon stick||4 green cardamom||3 tomatoes chopped||2 cups water||Salt to taste||Fresh cilantro
instructions: Heat mustard oil in heavy bottom pot||Add whole spices and fry for 30 seconds||Add sliced onions and cook until deep golden||Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes||Add mutton pieces and brown on all sides||Add all dry spices and mix well||Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft||Add green chilies and salt||Add water and bring to boil||Cover and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until tender||Stir occasionally and add water if needed||Cook until gravy is thick||Garnish with cilantro and serve hot
recipe_notes: Slow cooking is essential for tender mutton. Don't rush the process

title: Kichuri with Bhaja
description: Traditional Bengali rice and lentil dish with fried vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||1/2 cup moong dal||1 medium onion sliced||2 potatoes cubed||1 eggplant cubed||4 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 bay leaves||1 inch ginger||4 tbsp mustard oil||Salt to taste
instructions: Wash rice and dal together||Heat oil, add cumin and bay leaves||Fry vegetables separately until golden||In same oil, add ginger and chilies||Add rice-dal mixture with turmeric||Add 4 cups water and salt||Cook covered for 25 minutes||Serve hot with fried vegetables
recipe_notes: Add ghee on top for extra richness. Serve with pickles and papad

title: Paratha with Omelet
description: Flaky layered bread with spiced scrambled eggs
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour||4 eggs||1 medium onion chopped||2 green chilies||1 tsp red chili powder||1/2 tsp turmeric||Fresh cilantro||4 tbsp oil||2 tbsp ghee||Salt to taste
instructions: Make dough with flour, salt, and water||Rest for 30 minutes||Roll paratha with ghee layers||Cook on tawa until golden||Beat eggs with spices and onions||Scramble eggs in oil||Serve hot paratha with omelet
recipe_notes: Make parathas ahead and reheat. Add cheese to omelet for variation

title: Panta Bhat with Ilish
description: Fermented rice with hilsa fish curry - Bengali delicacy
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice||300g hilsa fish||1 large onion||4 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp panch phoron||2 tbsp mustard oil||Salt to taste||Water for soaking
instructions: Soak cooked rice in water overnight||Clean and cut hilsa fish||Heat oil, add panch phoron||Fry fish pieces until golden||Add onions and spices||Cook fish curry for 15 minutes||Serve panta bhat with fish curry
recipe_notes: Traditional Bengali New Year breakfast. Add raw onions and green chilies on side

title: Luchi with Aloo Dum
description: Deep-fried bread with spiced potato curry
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour||500g small potatoes||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 tsp garam masala||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp turmeric||2 tbsp ghee||Oil for frying||Salt to taste
instructions: Make soft dough with flour and ghee||Rest for 45 minutes||Boil potatoes until tender||Heat oil, add whole spices||Add potatoes with all spices||Cook covered for 20 minutes||Roll and fry luchis||Serve hot together
recipe_notes: Luchis should puff up while frying. Keep oil temperature moderate

title: Doi Chira
description: Flattened rice with yogurt and jaggery - cooling breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups thick poha||1 cup thick yogurt||3 tbsp jaggery||1/4 cup milk||2 tbsp roasted peanuts||1 banana sliced||1 tsp cardamom powder||Pinch of salt
instructions: Wash poha and drain well||Mix yogurt with jaggery and milk||Add cardamom and salt||Soak poha in yogurt mixture||Let it rest for 15 minutes||Garnish with banana and peanuts||Serve chilled
recipe_notes: Perfect for summer mornings. Add more fruits as desired

title: Sutki Bhorta with Rice
description: Dried fish mash with steamed rice - rustic breakfast
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||100g dried fish||4 green chilies||1 medium onion||3 cloves garlic||1 inch ginger||2 tbsp mustard oil||1 tsp turmeric||Salt to taste
instructions: Cook rice until fluffy||Clean and soak dried fish||Pound fish with chilies in mortar||Heat oil, fry onions until golden||Add ginger-garlic paste||Add fish mixture and turmeric||Cook for 10 minutes||Serve with hot rice
recipe_notes: Authentic village-style breakfast. Adjust chilies to taste

title: Kheer with Puri
description: Sweet rice pudding with crispy fried bread
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice||1 liter full-fat milk||1/2 cup sugar||1/4 cup almonds||1/4 cup raisins||1 tsp cardamom||2 cups flour||Oil for frying||2 tbsp ghee
instructions: Boil rice in milk until soft||Cook for 1 hour stirring frequently||Add sugar and cardamom||Garnish with nuts and raisins||Make dough for puris||Roll small puris and deep fry||Serve kheer with hot puris
recipe_notes: Traditional festival breakfast. Cook kheer on low heat for best texture

title: Muri Ghonto
description: Fish head curry with rice - traditional Bengali breakfast
ingredients: 1 large fish head||2 cups rice||1 cup mixed vegetables||2 bay leaves||1 tsp panch phoron||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||3 tbsp mustard oil||Salt to taste
instructions: Clean fish head thoroughly||Heat oil, fry fish head||Remove and fry vegetables||Add whole spices and ground spices||Add fish head back||Add water and cook covered||Add rice and cook together||Simmer for 25 minutes
recipe_notes: Sunday special breakfast. Use rohu or katla fish head

title: Chitoi Pitha
description: Traditional rice pancakes with coconut jaggery
ingredients: 2 cups rice flour||1 cup grated coconut||1/2 cup jaggery||1/4 cup milk||1 tsp cardamom||Pinch of salt||Oil for cooking
instructions: Make batter with rice flour and water||Rest for 30 minutes||Heat special chitoi pan||Pour batter to make thin pancakes||Cook until edges lift||Mix coconut with jaggery||Serve hot with coconut filling
recipe_notes: Need special chitoi pan or non-stick pan. Winter breakfast specialty

title: Begun Bhaja with Panta
description: Fried eggplant with fermented rice - rustic breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice||2 large eggplants||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1/2 tsp salt||4 tbsp mustard oil||4 green chilies||1 onion sliced
instructions: Soak rice in water overnight||Slice eggplants thick||Marinate with turmeric and salt||Heat oil in pan||Fry eggplant slices until golden||Serve panta bhat with hot bhaja||Garnish with chilies and onions
recipe_notes: Traditional monsoon breakfast. Serve with raw chilies and onions

title: Halwa Puri
description: Sweet semolina pudding with fried bread
ingredients: 1 cup semolina||2 cups flour||1 cup sugar||2 cups milk||1/4 cup ghee||1/4 cup almonds||1/4 cup pistachios||1 tsp cardamom||Oil for frying||Pinch of salt
instructions: Roast semolina until golden||Add milk gradually||Cook stirring continuously||Add sugar and cardamom||Cook until thick||Garnish with nuts||Make puri dough||Roll and fry puris||Serve hot together
recipe_notes: Weekend special breakfast. Cook halwa on low heat to avoid lumps

title: Daler Bora with Payesh
description: Lentil fritters with rice pudding - festival breakfast
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal||1 cup rice||1 liter milk||1/2 cup sugar||1 inch ginger||4 green chilies||1 tsp cumin seeds||Oil for frying||1 tsp cardamom
instructions: Soak dal for 4 hours||Grind to smooth paste||Add chilies and ginger||Heat oil and fry boras||Boil rice in milk||Cook until creamy||Add sugar and cardamom||Serve boras with payesh
recipe_notes: Durga Puja special breakfast. Dal should be ground without water

title: Shorshe Ilish with Rice
description: Hilsa fish in mustard sauce with steamed rice
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice||400g hilsa fish||3 tbsp mustard seeds||4 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp kalonji||3 tbsp mustard oil||Salt to taste
instructions: Cook rice until fluffy||Soak mustard seeds for 30 minutes||Grind to smooth paste||Marinate fish with turmeric||Heat oil, add kalonji||Fry fish lightly||Add mustard paste and chilies||Cook covered for 15 minutes||Serve with rice
recipe_notes: Signature Bengali dish. Don't overcook the fish

title: Mishti Doi with Moa
description: Sweet yogurt with rice flakes balls - winter breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups thick yogurt||1/2 cup condensed milk||2 cups puffed rice||1/2 cup jaggery||1/4 cup ghee||1 tsp cardamom||2 tbsp coconut||1/4 cup milk powder
instructions: Mix yogurt with condensed milk||Set in earthen pots||Keep in warm place overnight||Roast puffed rice with ghee||Add jaggery and mix well||Shape into balls||Serve mishti doi with moa
recipe_notes: Winter morning specialty. Set doi in clay pots for best taste

title: Chingri Malai Curry with Luchi
description: Prawns in coconut milk with fried bread - luxury breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups flour||500g large prawns||1 cup coconut milk||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 tsp red chili powder||1 inch ginger||3 tbsp ghee||Oil for frying||Salt to taste
instructions: Clean and devein prawns||Marinate with turmeric and salt||Make luchi dough with ghee||Heat oil, fry prawns||Add whole spices||Pour coconut milk||Simmer for 15 minutes||Roll and fry luchis||Serve hot together
recipe_notes: Special occasion breakfast. Use fresh coconut milk for best taste

title: Bhapa Pitha
description: Steamed rice cakes with coconut jaggery filling
ingredients: 2 cups rice flour||1 cup grated coconut||1/2 cup jaggery||1/4 cup khoya||1 tsp cardamom||Pinch of salt||Banana leaves||1 cup hot water
instructions: Mix rice flour with hot water||Knead into smooth dough||Mix coconut with jaggery and khoya||Make small dumplings with filling||Wrap in banana leaves||Steam for 20 minutes||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Winter pitha festival special. Banana leaves give authentic flavor

title: Mutton Curry with Paratha
description: Spiced goat curry with layered bread - weekend breakfast
ingredients: 500g mutton||2 cups flour||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 tsp garam masala||1 tsp red chili powder||1 inch ginger||4 tbsp ghee||1 large onion||Salt to taste
instructions: Marinate mutton with spices||Cook in pressure cooker||Make paratha dough with ghee||Rest for 45 minutes||Fry onions until golden||Add mutton with marinade||Cook until thick gravy||Roll layered parathas||Cook on tawa||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Weekend special breakfast. Marinate mutton overnight for best taste

title: Nimki with Tea
description: Crispy savory crackers with spiced tea
ingredients: 2 cups flour||1 tsp ajwain||1/2 tsp red chili powder||4 tbsp oil||2 cups water||2 tsp tea leaves||1 inch ginger||4 green cardamom||1 inch cinnamon||Salt to taste
instructions: Make stiff dough with flour and oil||Add ajwain and chili powder||Roll thin and cut diamond shapes||Deep fry until golden||Store in airtight container||Boil water with whole spices||Add tea leaves and milk||Serve nimki with hot tea
recipe_notes: Perfect morning snack with tea. Nimki stays crispy for days

title: Fish Fry with Panta Bhat
description: Crispy fried fish with fermented rice
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice||4 pieces rohu fish||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1/2 tsp garam masala||3 tbsp mustard oil||1 tsp ginger-garlic paste||Salt to taste||4 green chilies||1 onion sliced
instructions: Soak cooked rice overnight||Marinate fish with all spices||Rest for 30 minutes||Heat oil in pan||Fry fish until golden and crispy||Serve panta bhat with hot fish fry||Garnish with chilies and onions
recipe_notes: Traditional summer breakfast. Fish should be well-marinated

title: Jhal Muri
description: Spicy puffed rice mix - street food breakfast
ingredients: 3 cups puffed rice||1 cucumber diced||1 tomato diced||1 boiled potato||2 green chilies||1 tsp mustard oil||1 tsp tamarind water||1/2 tsp chaat masala||Fresh cilantro||Salt to taste
instructions: Mix puffed rice in large bowl||Add diced vegetables||Chop chilies finely||Add mustard oil and tamarind||Sprinkle chaat masala||Mix everything well||Garnish with cilantro||Serve immediately
recipe_notes: Popular street breakfast. Serve immediately after mixing

title: Ruti with Dal
description: Whole wheat flatbread with spiced lentil curry
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour||1 cup masoor dal||1 medium onion||2 green chilies||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp cumin seeds||2 tbsp oil||1 tsp ginger paste||Salt to taste||2 cups water
instructions: Make dough with wheat flour||Rest for 30 minutes||Wash and boil dal||Heat oil, add cumin seeds||Fry onions until golden||Add ginger and chilies||Add boiled dal with spices||Cook until thick||Roll thin rutis||Cook on dry tawa||Serve hot
recipe_notes: Healthy breakfast option. Ruti should be thin and soft

title: Aloo Chop with Puri
description: Spiced potato cutlets with fried bread
ingredients: 4 large potatoes||2 cups flour||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp garam masala||1 egg||1 cup breadcrumbs||Oil for frying||2 green chilies||1 tsp ginger paste||Salt to taste
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes||Add spices and chilies||Shape into cutlets||Dip in beaten egg||Coat with breadcrumbs||Deep fry until golden||Make puri dough||Roll small puris||Fry until puffed||Serve hot together
recipe_notes: Evening tiffin or breakfast snack. Chill cutlets before frying

title: Sandesh with Payesh
description: Bengali sweets with rice pudding - festival breakfast
ingredients: 2 liters full fat milk||1 cup rice||1/2 cup sugar||2 tbsp lemon juice||1 tsp cardamom||1/4 cup pistachios||2 tbsp ghee||Pinch of saffron
instructions: Heat milk, add lemon juice||Strain to make chenna||Knead chenna until smooth||Cook with sugar until thick||Shape into sandesh||Boil rice in remaining milk||Cook until creamy||Add sugar and cardamom||Serve together
recipe_notes: Festival special breakfast. Don't overcook chenna

title: Dhokar Dalna with Rice
description: Steamed lentil cakes in curry with rice
ingredients: 2 cups rice||1 cup chana dal||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp garam masala||3 tbsp oil||1 inch ginger||2 green chilies||Salt to taste
instructions: Soak dal for 4 hours||Grind to smooth paste||Steam in greased pan||Cut into diamond shapes||Fry lightly||Heat oil, add whole spices||Add tomatoes and spices||Add dhoka pieces||Simmer in gravy||Serve with rice
recipe_notes: Weekend special breakfast. Steam dhoka properly to avoid breaking

title: Ghugni with Luchi
description: Yellow pea curry with fried bread - comfort breakfast
ingredients: 2 cups flour||1 cup dried yellow peas||1 large onion||2 bay leaves||1 tsp cumin seeds||1 tsp turmeric||1 tsp red chili powder||1 tsp garam masala||3 tbsp oil||2 tbsp ghee||Salt to taste
instructions: Soak peas overnight||Pressure cook until soft||Make luchi dough with ghee||Heat oil, add whole spices||Fry onions until golden||Add cooked peas with spices||Cook until thick||Roll and fry luchis||Serve hot together
recipe_notes: Comfort food breakfast. Ghugni should have thick consistency
